title: Do Americans approve of Trump? What polls say a month into office
shortDescription: President Donald Trump has been in office for a month and his administration launched into a flurry of executive actions, court challenges and DOGE directives.

title: Congress can't conduct surprise review of Guantanamo Bay ICE camp
shortDescription: Holding migrants at Guantanamo makes an end run around congressional power, several members say.

title: Videos of Jesus statue at White House not legitimate | Fact check
shortDescription: The videos are digital creations consistent with content generated by AI. A livestream of the White House shows no statue being built.

title: 'See you in court': Trump, Maine governor clash over trans athletes
shortDescription: President Trump and Maine Gov. Janet Mills clashed over Trump's order banning transgender athletes from playing in girl and women sports.

title: Democrats elect Ken Martin as chair to rebuild demoralized party
shortDescription: The Democratic National Committee elected Ken Martin as its new chair on Saturday, Feb. 1, 2025, as it looks to rebuild after the party's election loss to Donald Trump.

title: Trump is firing federal workers who are not funded by taxpayers
shortDescription: Elon Musk's DOGE team has slashed hundreds of jobs paid for by fees from banks and other forms of funding rather than taxpayer dollars.

title: DOGE drama: GOP lawmakers get an angry earful back home
shortDescription: It's the first indication that some Republican lawmakers may field challenges from voters over Elon Musk's massive changes.

title: Which firings has the Trump administration rescinded?
shortDescription: Some employees caught in the Trump administration's mass layoffs have been offered their jobs back.

title: Senate passes only part of Trump agenda, setting up clash with House
shortDescription: The overnight session featured dozens of amendments from Democrats designed to create campaign fodder.

title: Unemployment benefits: Supreme Court says these workers can sue
shortDescription: An independent shrimper in Alabama spent months fighting for benefits during the COVID-19 pandemic. The Supreme Court ruled he and others have the right to sue.

title: Trump fires federal workers who help fight forest fires | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: NY Gov. Kathy Hochul won't oust Mayor Eric Adams but vows oversight. | More than half a million Haitian refugees will lose protected status.

title: 'Should I run again?' Trump keeps talking about third term
shortDescription: Trump raised the topic of another term Thursday during a Black History Month event at the White House and during a speech to Republican governors.

title: Senate passes GOP border security bill without Trump tax cuts
shortDescription: The Senate passed a Republican bill promoting President Donald Trump's immigration, energy and defense policies in the early hours of Friday.

title: Trump wants NYCâ€™s congestion pricing dead. Will it be roadkill?
shortDescription: MTA head Janno Lieber said 1.2 million fewer vehicles went into Manhattan's central business district in January.

title: How Trump's federal employee cuts differ from Clinton's
shortDescription: Elon Musk compared Trump's mass firings to Clinton-era federal streamlining, but the architect of Clinton's plan says they're very different.

title: Hammer time: Trump's first month was just a preview, insiders say
shortDescription: Critics say the president is on a scorched-earth campaign to raze the federal government. The White House says he's delivering for voters.

title: IRS fires 6,000 employees as Trump slashes US government
shortDescription: A tearful executive at the U.S. Internal Revenue Service told staffers on Thursday that about 6,000 employees would be fired.

title: White House hosts Black History Month
shortDescription: President Trump hosted a Black History Month event at the White House as his administration rolls back diversity, equity and inclusion programs.

title: Trump celebrates Black History Month after dropping diversity programs
shortDescription: Trump told a cheering crowd that he was fighting 'for Black Americans and all Americans' at a Black History Month reception at the White House.

title: Trump backs direct payments to Americans from savings generated by DOGE
shortDescription: President Trump backed an idea pitched to Elon Musk of sending checks of up to $5,000 to Americans if DOGE is able to cut federal government costs.
